A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Loved it! Maybe not quite as good as the original trilogy\, but close. Leagues better than the prequels\, but that’s not difficult. Just as good as The Force Awakens. Ryan Johnson does an amazing job of turning a formulaic arc into an unpredictable resolution. That’s something George Lucas was never able to accomplish\, or never cared to. This seems to have angered fans who want Star Wars to keep following basic hero formulas that they can relate to. However\, for someone who is tired of the old groove Hollywood seems to be stuck in with hero worshiping blood lines and making heroes unrealistically pure\, it’s a fresh and thrilling infusion of new energy.
